item.title: Asians in higher education and the "model minority" myth
item.dc:creator: Christina Sukhgian Houle
item.content:encoded:
2015 study published in the Review of Educational Research that examines 112 studies on Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders in higher education, with a focus on the "model minority" myth.

The post Asians in higher education: Research review of the “model minority” myth appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2015 study published in the Review of Educational Research that examines 112 studies on Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders in higher education, with a focus on the "model minority" myth.

The post Asians in higher education: Research review of the “model minority” myth appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: How the news media impacts suicide trends: Research roundup
item.dc:creator: Denise-Marie Ordway
item.content:encoded:
2016 roundup of research that looks at the media's coverage of suicide and mental illness in different countries and how news stories influence suicide-related trends.

The post How the news media impacts suicide trends: Research roundup appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2016 roundup of research that looks at the media's coverage of suicide and mental illness in different countries and how news stories influence suicide-related trends.

The post How the news media impacts suicide trends: Research roundup appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: Negative political ads and voter effects: Research roundup
item.dc:creator: John Wihbey
item.content:encoded:
Updated May 2013: A review of scholarship and resources related to negative campaign advertising and its effects.

The post Negative political ads and voter effects: Research roundup appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: Lead poisoning: Sources of exposure, health effects
item.dc:creator: Kathryn M. Barker
item.content:encoded:
2016 collection of research about lead poisoning, including sources of exposure, health effects and policy implications.

The post Lead poisoning: Sources of exposure, health effects and policy implications appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: How unemployment affects serious property crime: A national study
item.dc:creator: Pooja Gupta
item.content:encoded:
2016 study from researchers at Florida State University that examines whether joblessness affects the commission of serious property crime, specifically robbery and burglary.

The post How unemployment affects serious property crime: A national case-control study appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2016 study from researchers at Florida State University that examines whether joblessness affects the commission of serious property crime, specifically robbery and burglary.

The post How unemployment affects serious property crime: A national case-control study appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: U.S. prison boom: Impact on age of state prisoners
item.dc:creator: Lauren Leatherby
item.content:encoded:
2016 study published in Criminology that explores changes in the age distribution of prisoners during the U.S. prison boom that began in the late 20th century.

The post U.S. prison boom: Impact on age of state prisoners appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2016 study published in Criminology that explores changes in the age distribution of prisoners during the U.S. prison boom that began in the late 20th century.

The post U.S. prison boom: Impact on age of state prisoners appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: New, open source syllabus: Journalism Ethics in the Digital Age
item.dc:creator: Journalist's Resource
item.content:encoded:
Semester-long course that offers aspiring journalists a strong foundation in ethical decision-making, with a focus on the challenges created by digital technology, social media and evolving newsgathering practices.

The post Journalism Ethics in the Digital Age: A Model/Open Source Syllabus appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
Semester-long course that offers aspiring journalists a strong foundation in ethical decision-making, with a focus on the challenges created by digital technology, social media and evolving newsgathering practices.

The post Journalism Ethics in the Digital Age: A Model/Open Source Syllabus appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: Global rise in human infectious disease outbreaks
item.dc:creator: Natasha Sokol
item.content:encoded:
2014 study in the Journal of the Royal Society Interface that examines the relationship between the location and timing of disease outbreaks and the characteristics of outbreak sites.

The post Global trends in human infectious disease: Rising number of outbreaks, fewer per-capita cases appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2014 study in the Journal of the Royal Society Interface that examines the relationship between the location and timing of disease outbreaks and the characteristics of outbreak sites.

The post Global trends in human infectious disease: Rising number of outbreaks, fewer per-capita cases appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: Solitary confinement in prisons: Key research findings
item.dc:creator: John Wihbey
item.content:encoded:
2014 study in the American Journal of Public Health showing a "strong association" between solitary confinement and acts of self-harm.

The post Solitary confinement in prisons: Key data and research findings appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2014 study in the American Journal of Public Health showing a "strong association" between solitary confinement and acts of self-harm.

item.title: HPV vaccines: Safety, youth vaccination rates and male participation
item.dc:creator: Farah Qureshi
item.content:encoded:
2016 collection of research that looks at the Human Papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine from various angles, including vaccination rates, vaccine safety and the real and perceived barriers to vaccination.

The post HPV vaccines: Research on safety, racial disparities in vaccination rates and male participation appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2016 collection of research that looks at the Human Papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine from various angles, including vaccination rates, vaccine safety and the real and perceived barriers to vaccination.

The post HPV vaccines: Research on safety, racial disparities in vaccination rates and male participation appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: Teen drivers: Effect of Graduated Driver Licensing (GDL) decals
item.dc:creator: Lauren Leatherby
item.content:encoded:
2015 study published in the American Journal of Preventive Medicine that examines the long-term effect of New Jersey’s Graduated Driver Licensing (GDL) decal requirement for young drivers.

The post Teen drivers: Changes in crash rates after requiring Graduated Driver Licensing (GDL) decals appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2015 study published in the American Journal of Preventive Medicine that examines the long-term effect of New Jersey’s Graduated Driver Licensing (GDL) decal requirement for young drivers.

The post Teen drivers: Changes in crash rates after requiring Graduated Driver Licensing (GDL) decals appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: Discrimination and wellbeing for transgender Americans
item.dc:creator: Scholars Strategy Network
item.content:encoded:
2016 research brief from the Scholars Strategy Network that offers insights into the discrimination faced by transgender Americans, including its impacts on health and wellbeing.

item.title: Research on "global warming" versus "climate change"
item.dc:creator: Leighton Walter Kille
item.content:encoded:
2014 study from Yale University and George Mason University based on two nationally representative surveys on how Americans react to the use of the two terms.

The post Research on what “global warming” and “climate change” mean, and when to use the terms appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2014 study from Yale University and George Mason University based on two nationally representative surveys on how Americans react to the use of the two terms.

The post Research on what “global warming” and “climate change” mean, and when to use the terms appeared first on Journalist's Resource.

item.title: Student suspension: Impact on academic achievement by race
item.dc:creator: Denise-Marie Ordway
item.content:encoded:
2016 study published in Social Problems that examines how racial disparities in school suspension rates affect racial differences in student achievement in math and reading.

The post Student suspension from school: Impact on academic achievement by race appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
item.description:
2016 study published in Social Problems that examines how racial disparities in school suspension rates affect racial differences in student achievement in math and reading.

item.title: Journalism branding: Impact on reporters' personal identity
item.dc:creator: Denise-Marie Ordway
item.content:encoded:
2015 study from scholars at The University of Utah and Temple University that examines how journalism branding efforts affect the personal identities of journalists.

The post Journalism branding: Impact on reporters’ personal identities appeared first on Journalist's Resource.
